entry.title: Re: Currency USD provided is incorrect for Product MCOBL-...
entry.content:
Good day @maggie2 

Thank you for your question and the detailed screenshots.

I recommend you consult Product,  Master Data Consistency & Currencies for more details.

The error you are facing means that the currency you entered in the migration template does not match the local currency of the company code assigned to the valuation area 0003. In public cloud, the valuation currency is derived from the company code configuration and cannot be overridden in migration. Please check which company code is assigned to valuation area 0003 and use that company‚Äôs local currency in your valuation data sheet. Once you have aligned it, the error will no longer appear during simulation.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Im BW mit Routine Hashtag erstetzen
entry.content:
Hi Johannes,

# is most likely representing a non-printable character. That's why replacing '#' does not work as expected.

You can try replacing non-printable characters with a regular expression like this:

REPLACE ALL OCCURRENCES OF REGEX '[^[:print:]]' IN lv_text WITH ''.

Note that you may have to adapt the solution proposal above according to your business requirements.

Regards,
Dominik

entry.title: Re: Duplicate Materials issue in large based companies
entry.content:
Hello @BANDLAVENKATESH 

I think it is perfectly fine to have multiple materials with the same controlling / technical fields as long as they model different products. In my opinion, a material qualifies as a duplicate if it redundantly models a product that is already modelled with another material. I do understand the vagueness of this statement - it really depends on your specific environment if a material is a legitimate duplicate or not. That is why large organizations use tools like SAP MDG do manage master data.

Marking a duplicate material with LVORM is not enough in my mind. You would also need to transfer existing stock from a duplicate to a legitimate material, also consider open documents of the duplicate. 

Bear in mind that marking a material for deletion (LVORM = X) doesn't not prevent its usage in general, e.g. the note 2821773 - Sales order can be created with a material marked for deletion 

Best regards

Dominik Tylczynski

entry.title: Re: Revenue recognition key EPMFC EPPM (Project Managemen...
entry.content:
Good day @summy 

Thank you for your question and the detailed screenshots.

I recommend you consult Cost-Based Percentage of Completion,  Event-Based Revenue Recognition & Revenue and Cost Accounting for more details.

To summarise, when you use the cost-based revenue recognition key EPMFC in public cloud, the system caps the percentage at 100%, even if your actual costs exceed planned costs. The cost overrun will not trigger additional revenue recognition beyond the planned revenue. This is designed to align with IFRS 15 and GAAP, thereby ensuring that recognised revenue cannot exceed the contractual revenue. Therefore, in your example, when your planned cost = 500 and actual cost = 1,000, the recognised revenue remains 1,000 which is your defined 100% and not 2,000 which will equal 200%.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: SAP Datasphere - Architecture and Lessons-Learned
entry.content:
SAP Datasphere Space Organization Strategy and Outlook with SAP Business Data Cloud

Hello,

Thank you for this article, which aptly summarizes the strategic thinking we are currently engaged in. Your proposals resonate with the architectures we have deployed and those we envision for the future.

Here is a summary of our experience and vision.

1. Tenant Strategy

Regarding tenant strategy, our experience with our clients has led us, primarily for cost management reasons, to favor architectures based on one or two tenants. A three-tenant approach is not currently recommended in our project contexts.

2. Current Space Architecture

Our current structure is designed to ensure strong governance while offering flexibility to the business teams. It is structured as follows:

  • A/ Administration and Connections Space: Strictly reserved for IT, this space centralizes the management of connections to source systems.

  • B/ Analytical Model Development Space: Also managed by IT, this space is dedicated to the development and certification of central analytical models (the "core model").

  • C/ Authorization Tables Management Space: A dedicated space that ensures centralized and secure governance of data access.

  • D/ Dedicated Business Spaces: For each line of business, we provision a space where copies of the models from space (B) are exposed. This approach allows Power Users:

    • To evolve their own models autonomously, without impacting the original certified models.

    • To test specific use cases. If a need proves relevant and recurring, it can then be industrialized by IT for integration into the central model.

This model empowers the business teams with control over reporting, thus fulfilling the promise of agility initially conveyed by the Business Layer concept.

Security Consideration: A key feature of our architecture is data segregation. The technical spaces (A and B) are systematically duplicated to isolate HR data and sources from non-HR data, thereby guaranteeing the confidentiality of sensitive information, even from the development teams.

3. Evolution Perspective towards SAP Business Data Cloud (BDC)

The evolution of SAP Datasphere towards SAP BDC encourages us to consider an architecture aligned with the platform's best practices, structured in layers:

  • A/ Acquisition Space: Centralization of all raw data (local tables, remote views) and replication flows.

  • B/ Modeling Space: Development of all transformation logic and the semantic layer (SQL views, graphical views) necessary for building the final models.

  • C/ Reporting Space: Exposure of the final analytical models, constituting the single source of truth for consumption in SAP Analytics Cloud.

This architecture is similar to your latest proposal. However, in our concept, we would maintain the principle of autonomous business spaces downstream. These spaces would consume the models from the reporting space (C) but would still allow business teams to create and adapt copies, thereby preserving their agility in creating and modifying their own analytical models.

This hybrid approach would allow us to combine robust, centralized data governance with the essential autonomy for end-users.

Best regards, Patrice Mathieu

entry.title: Re: Tax number error or validation in Business partner
entry.content: Implementing cross-field validation to ensure a Business Partner's GSTIN State Code (first two digits of the TAX number) matches the Region/State in their address is not standard SAP functionality. This crucial business requirement must be achieved via a Custom Enhancement, specifically a Business Add-In (BAdI) in the BP master data process. An ABAP developer is required to code the logic to read both fields, compare them, and trigger a mandatory Error or Warning message if they do not correspond, preventing the user from saving the invalid data.

entry.title: Re: How to grey out the Delete button in VA02Ôºü
entry.content:
Hello @WUYIN ,

In S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition, the T-code VA02 is not applicable. Use the Fiori app Manage Sales Orders and control the Delete function via IAM, UI adaptation, or a Cloud BAdI.

  1. IAM (Maintain Business Roles) ‚Üí set Delete to Not Allowed for Manage Sales Orders. This approach is the clean, security-focused method.SAP Community-Using Restrictions to Enhance User Authorizations in the SAP S/4HANA Cloud, public edition

2.Adapt UI (optional) ‚Üí hide the Delete action for a cleaner screen (cosmetic only). UI5 Demo Kit

3.Cloud BAdI (optional, enforce rules) ‚Üí Utilise the deletion-check BAdI to prevent deletions with a message (e.g., when a delivery exists).

  • KBA 3152093 - BADI - SD_SLS_CHECK_DELETE_ITEM - Initiated in Manage Sales Orders when removing delivery block
  • KBA 3468218 - Reject or delete all unconfirmed items at once in a sales order using application Mass Change of Sales Orders - S/4HANA Cloud

Recommendation :

Perform step #1 for all end users; optionally, execute step #2 for UX; and proceed with step #3 if conditional business rules are needed, for example, never delete after good's issue.

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to grey out the Delete button in VA02Ôºü
entry.content:
Hello @WUYIN 

Thank you for your question and the detailed screenshots.

In public cloud, you cannot directly modify GUI screens or grey out buttons when you use exits or screen variants. However, there are some supported ways to enable you control the delete action.

Option 1 is to: Use the Maintain Business Roles app. Open your user role √† go to General Restrictions √† Business Catalogs √† and remove access to the Delete Sales Order action. This automatically hides or disables the Delete button for that role.

Option 2 is to Adapt UI for your Fiori Apps. In the Manage Sales Orders or Change Sales Orders app, open Adapt UI, hide the Delete button, and publish the change for the relevant business role.

Option 3 requires a BAdI (Custom Logic). For you to technically safeguard the function, use the Custom Logic app and implement BAdI SD_SLS_MODIFY_ITEM OR SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEADER to block deleteion attempt

I recommend you consult Key User Extensibility on SAP S/4HANA Cloud ‚Äì Adding Custom Business Logic,  Extensibility & Maintain Business Roles for more details.

Let me know if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: SAP MDG : Accessing Change Request Data by Business Activity & Change Request Type
entry.content:
Hi SCN Folks, 

Hope you guys are doing great üôÇ

Note 01: This blog does not include execution screenshots.
Note 02: The entire code was developed and validated in the SANDBOX system, with results meeting expectations.
Note 03: There are several ways; this blog is written about one of them.

Create one custom class, with 02 methods:

ZCL_MDGS_ASSISTIVE

GET_INSTANCE_GOV_API

* <SIGNATURE>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
* | Static Public Method ZCL_MDGS_ASSISTIVE=>GET_INSTANCE_GOV_API
* +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
* | [--->] IV_MODEL                       TYPE        USMD_MODEL
* | [<---] EV_INSTANCE_EXISTS             TYPE        ABAP_BOOL
* | [<---] EO_GOV_API                     TYPE REF TO CL_USMD_GOV_API
* +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</SIGNATURE>
  METHOD get_instance_gov_api.
    DATA: lo_gov_api   TYPE REF TO if_usmd_gov_api,
          lo_cx_root   TYPE REF TO cx_root,
          lv_exception TYPE        string.
    IF cl_usmd_gov_api=>check_instance_exists( iv_model_name = iv_model ) EQ abap_false.
      ev_instance_exists = abap_false.
      TRY.
          cl_usmd_gov_api=>get_instance(
            EXPORTING
              iv_model_name = iv_model
            RECEIVING
              ro_gov_api    = lo_gov_api
          ).
        CATCH cx_usmd_gov_api INTO lo_cx_root.
          lv_exception = lo_cx_root->get_text( ).
      ENDTRY.
      IF lv_exception IS INITIAL AND
         lo_gov_api   IS BOUND.
        eo_gov_api ?= lo_gov_api.
      ENDIF.
    ELSE.
      ev_instance_exists = abap_true.
      TRY.
          cl_usmd_gov_api=>get_instance(
            EXPORTING
              iv_model_name = iv_model
            RECEIVING
              ro_gov_api    = lo_gov_api
          ).
        CATCH cx_usmd_gov_api INTO lo_cx_root.
          lv_exception = lo_cx_root->get_text( ).
      ENDTRY.
      IF lv_exception IS INITIAL AND
         lo_gov_api   IS BOUND.
        eo_gov_api ?= lo_gov_api.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

GET_CR_DATA 
(***Note: above method making use in this method)

* <SIGNATURE>---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
* | Static Public Method ZCL_MDGS_ASSISTIVE=>GET_CR_DATA
* +-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+
* | [--->] IV_CR_ID                       TYPE        USMD_CREQUEST
* | [<-->] CS_CR_ATTRIBUTES               TYPE        USMD_S_CREQUEST(optional)
* | [<-->] CV_MODEL                       TYPE        USMD_MODEL(optional)
* | [<-->] CV_CR_TYPE_PROCESS             TYPE        USMD_PROCESS(optional)
* | [<-()] RT_CR_DATA                     TYPE        USMD_TS_ENTITY_DATA_ALL
* +--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------</SIGNATURE>
    METHOD get_cr_data.
    DATA: lo_gov_api     TYPE REF TO  cl_usmd_gov_api,
          lt_cr_data     TYPE         usmd_ts_entity_data_all,
          lv_model       TYPE         usmd_model,
          lv_inst_exists TYPE         abap_bool.
    " Determine the  model from CR ID to get the instance of
    " Goverance API.
    CHECK IV_CR_ID IS NOT INITIAL.
    IF NOT cv_model IS INITIAL.
      lv_model = cv_model.
    ELSE.
      cl_usmd_crequest_util=>get_model_by_cr(
        EXPORTING
          i_crequest = iv_cr_id
        IMPORTING
          e_model    = cv_model
      ).
    ENDIF.
    " Get the instance of the governance API
    IF NOT cv_model IS INITIAL.
      ZCL_MDGS_ASSISTIVE=>get_instance_gov_api(
        EXPORTING
          iv_model           = cv_model
        IMPORTING
          ev_instance_exists = lv_inst_exists
          eo_gov_api         = lo_gov_api
      ).
      " Read the data of the CR data using the Governance API
      IF lo_gov_api IS BOUND.
        lo_gov_api->if_usmd_gov_api_cr_data~get_crequest_data(
          EXPORTING
            iv_crequest_id          = iv_cr_id
          IMPORTING
            et_entity_data_inactive = rt_cr_data
        ).
        " CR Header Data
        cs_cr_attributes = lo_gov_api->if_usmd_gov_api_cr_data~get_crequest_attributes( iv_crequest_id = iv_cr_id  ).
        " CR Business activity or Business Process ID
        SELECT SINGLE usmd_process
                 FROM usmd1601
                 INTO _cr_type_process
                WHERE usmd_creq_type = _cr_attributes-usmd_creq_type.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
  ENDMETHOD.

Now, Making use of ZCL_MDGS_ASSISTIVE in system method caller implementation (if_usmd_ssw_syst_method_caller~call_system_method)

DATA: 
ls_crequest     TYPE usmd_s_crequest,
lv_model        TYPE usmd_model,
lv_cr_process   TYPE usmd_process,
lt_cr_data      TYPE usmd_ts_entity_data_all,
lt_supp_data  TYPE REF TO data.

FIELD-SYMBOLS:
<lt_supp_data> TYPE SORTED TABLE,
<ls_supp_data> TYPE any,
<lv_fno> TYPE any.

CALL METHOD zcl_mdgs_assistive=>get_cr_data
      EXPORTING
        iv_cr_id           = iv_cr_number
      CHANGING
        cs_cr_attributes   = ls_crequest
        cv_model           = lv_model
        cv_cr_type_process = lv_cr_process
      RECEIVING
        rt_cr_data         = lt_cr_data.

IF ls_crequest-usmd_creq_type = 'ZMDGS01',
 IF lv_cr_process = 'SUP1'.
  lt_supp_data = VALUE #( lt_cr_data[ usmd_entity = 'BP_HEADER' usmd_entity_cont = 'BP_CENTRL' struct = 'KATTR' ]-r_data  OPTIONAL ). 
   IF lt_supp_data IS BOUND .
    ASSIGN lt_supp_data->* TO <lt_supp_data>.
     IF <lt_supp_data> IS ASSIGNED.
      LOOP AT <lt_supp_data> ASSIGNING <ls_supp_data>.
       ASSIGN COMPONENT 'NAME_ORG1' OF STRUCTURE <ls_supp_data> TO <lv_fno>.
        IF <lv_fno> IS ASSIGNED AND <lv_fno> IS NOT INITIAL.
         .
         . "Requirement Logic etc...
         .
        ENDIF.
       ENDLOOP.
     ENDIF.
    ENDIF.
   ENDIF.
ENDIF.

SAP S/4HANA SAP Master Data Governance ABAP Development 

Thank You, 
Sandeep Suggu.
SAP Community Profile | SAP Profile | LinkedIn

entry.title: Re-initialization of a Table in a Replication Flow
entry.content:

I need to know whether, when I apply a change to my source table which is replicated through a Replication Flow in SAP Datasphere together with other tables‚Äîreinitializing the table in the Replication Flow requires restarting the entire Replication Flow (for all the tables in it) or only the specific table.

In addition, I‚Äôd like to understand how to perform this reinitialization without affecting the other tables: should I remove the table from the Replication Flow and add it again, or is it sufficient to restart the replication process for that table? entry.title: Supplier Contract for multiple Company Codes
entry.content:
Hi Team, 

One of my customers would like to see how to handle this scenario best in the S/4 Public Cloud: 

In the standard SAP system, purchase contracts can only be assigned to a single company code.
However, in the business practice of our customer, there are supplier contracts that are valid for several company codes and their
plants at the same time.

‚Ä¢ The customer creates more than 700 new purchase contracts on a monthly basis.
‚Ä¢ Each of these contracts must be duplicated for each company code.
‚Ä¢ This leads to significant additional effort, process delays, and a high risk of inconsistencies in changes.

Request:
We need the ability to consume purchase contracts across company codes for the central purchasing organization, so that plants from
multiple company codes can apply the same contract.

Added value:
‚Ä¢ Massive reduction of double maintenance effort (700+ contracts per month).
‚Ä¢ Improve data quality through centralized and consistent contract management.
‚Ä¢ Practical representation of a central purchasing organization with several company codes.

Does anyone have any input on this? 

Thanks and kind regards

Kathrin

entry.title: Certifications for Healthcare: A sense of assurance and trust
entry.content:
Ever wondered what happens behind the scenes of various apps and services offered by cloud service provider?  
Actually a lot. This covers the entire software product lifecycle of design, development, operations, delivery, maintenance, and feedback from customers and users.  

How do we trust that everything which happens behind the scenes is well executed and done, audited regularly and‚ÄØnothing is compromised at any stage?  

This is where various control measures, certifications, and audits play a critical role for‚ÄØtransparent and effective assessment. 
In this blog, I'll talk about SAP Health Data Services for FHIR.‚ÄØHow did we build assurance and trust throughout from design to active usage by our customers and partners? So, let's begin. 

Service and Organisation Controls (SOC) 

The Service and Organisation Controls or in short SOC certification reports are global standards. These certification reports offer a detailed understanding into the design and operational effectiveness of internal control systems implemented within cloud product.   

There are different types of SOC reports as described in the diagram after this. They also differ upon the duration on which these SOC reports are generated. ‚ÄØ 

SAP Health Data Services for FHIR is certified for both SOC 1 and SOC 2 reports. They're Type 2 reports which means controls are measured for a longer duration of time. What does this mean for you? 

For our Customers and Partners this certification is about assurance on the effectiveness of SAP controls related to financial reporting, security, availability, processing integrity, confidentiality, and privacy. Some of the controls and corresponding importance are highlighted in the following diagram. 

Personally, when I visit a hospital, I‚ÄØlike to have my data to be stored and processed with absolute confidentiality. Data is shared only on a need-to-know basis even within hospital staffs having proper authorization. This way I'm happy that my personal information and my sensitive data are secured and not misused.  

Now, let me take you through an attestation in the next section. 

Cloud Computing Compliance Criteria Catalogue (C5) 

The C5 (Cloud Computing Compliance Criteria Catalogue) is a comprehensive standard defined by the German Federal Office for Information Security (BSI). The C5 is attestation for truthfulness and authenticity about the security compliance from the cloud service provider. 

The C5 attestation is an independent and external audit which covers broad range of security aspects including governance, risk management, and technical controls. The C5 attestation also comes in two types which covers scope of the auditor‚Äôs report: 

It confirms that SAP Health Data Services for FHIR has undergone a rigorous audit, proving its strong security controls and operational transparency. The C5 audit report is of Type 2. 

For our Customers and Partners, this means a cloud service offers strong security measures and high operational efficiency. Some of the controls and corresponding importance are highlighted in the following diagram.  

The list is exhaustive. I'm listing down key controls which you can relate easily and are always on our mind. 

When I visit a hospital, I prefer not to hear ‚ÄúSystem is down‚Äù, which means billing can't be done or prescription can't be generated. The‚ÄØC5 attestation and audit helps to avoid these situations so that it doesn't happen with the cloud services used in hospital. ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ 

International Organisation for Standardisation (ISO/IEC ‚Äì 27000 family of standards) 

ISO standards are external certifications offered in accordance with ISO guidelines and are independent of any industry. It's a set of standards used globally by organisations of all sizes and sectors to ensure compliance, safeguard sensitive data and improve trust with stakeholders.  

The standard mainly talks about the Information Security Management System (ISMS), its adoption and effective implementation by an Organisation, in the context of this blog, its cloud service provider. ISMS preserves the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of information by applying a risk management process and gives confidence to interested parties that risks are adequately managed. 

Some of the important measures and controls of the standard along with corresponding importance are listed in the following diagram. As you see, most of them apply to any industry and applicable to any product and services. 

 

SAP Health Data Services for FHIR in its product lifecycle is developed with the right set of roles and responsibilities defined. With awareness to the process, understanding of the risks involved and adherence to the performance evaluation.  

For our Customers and Partners, ISO standards‚ÄØmean that adequate due diligence and effective practices are followed for the service. 

Final words 

In healthcare industry where we deal with personal and sensitive data in highly regulated environment,‚ÄØit is of great significance to understand how well these apps and services are developed, maintained, and operated. 

Certification and attestation for the product and services ensures this for SAP Health Data Services for FHIR. When you use this service, you're consuming the assurance and trust which comes along with it.  

For more details about the certifications and attestations of SAP Health Data Services for FHIR visit the SAP Discovery Center page. For viewing compliance report, visit SAP Compliance Finder.  

Looking forward for further engagement on this topic, I welcome your ideas and comments.

entry.title: Re: Tax number error or validation in Business partner
entry.content:
The current standard behavior is SAP Public Cloud validates GSTIN format (length, alphanumeric pattern) but does not check if the GSTIN state code matches the supplier‚Äôs region or address by default. This means a supplier with Karnataka address can enter a GSTIN starting with 33 (Tamil Nadu) without error.

Below approach you can try

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, you can use Business Configuration (SSCUI) or Custom Fields and Logic (CFL) app. Implement a Validation BAdI such as BusinessPartnerTaxNumberCheck or similar logic in Supplier Master.

Logic:

  • Extract first two digits of GSTIN (state code).
  • Compare with Region code in BP address (table J_1ISTATECDM for mapping).
  • If mismatch ‚Üí Raise error or warning.

Also check SAP notes 2441042 and 2884058

entry.title: Partners unveil generative AI applications to solve real-time industry challenges with SAP and AWS
entry.content:
AWS SAP AI Co-Innovation Program

At SAP Sapphire 2025, SAP and Amazon Web Services (AWS) unveiled the AI co-innovation program aimed at assisting partners in developing Generative AI applications to address business challenges. This program integrates advanced GenAI technologies from SAP with Generative AI Services from AWS, complemented by SAP Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Data, to facilitate customer implementation journeys.

As a pivotal advancement in the SAP AI co-innovation program, AWS and SAP have established a new cohort in collaboration with SAP‚Äôs well-established Hack2Build initiative. This cohort provides support for the development, testing, and deployment of industry-specific applications. Partners are encouraged to develop industry-focused solutions utilizing AWS generative AI tools and services from Amazon Bedrock, including large language models (LLMs) such as Amazon Nova and Anthropic Claude within AI Foundation on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). This enables partners to swiftly develop and deploy AI applications tailored to their customers‚Äô SAP workloads.

Hack2Build

Hack2Build Cohort- September 2025 with AWS

 The new cohort of Hack2Build, an initiative of Partner Excellence Center, SAP Partner Ecosystem Success in collaboration with AI Partner Product Management, SAP Business AI and Amazon Web Services, brought together AI expertise from SAP and AWS and architects to expedite the development of partner Generative AI applications within a seven-day timeframe. Ten partners were selected across various regions as part of this initiative. Experts from SAP and AWS provided support and guidance to the selected ten partners on the chosen use cases. The hack phase commenced on September 22nd and concluded with an impressive demo jam on September 30th.

Partners selected for Hack2Build Cohort with AWS and SAP - September 2025

Hack2Build Cohort: üéâ Winners

In this blog post, we will delve into the generative AI solutions developed by the winning partners. These solutions leverage the capabilities of Generative AI Hub, a component of SAP AI Core, a service within the SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). By accessing various Large Language Models (LLMs) on Amazon Web Services (AWS) through the Amazon Bedrock platform, the partners have harnessed the power of generative AI to create innovative solutions.Hack2Build Cohort 2025-Winners' Podium- AWS SAP AI Co-Innovation

üßë‚Äç‚öñÔ∏èüßëüèª‚Äç‚öñÔ∏è Judges

 On September 30, 2025, a distinguished panel of senior leaders from SAP and AWS convened to select three winners from the demo jam.

  • Kamal Arora, Director of Solutions Architecture and AI Innovation at AWS USA
  • Marc-Oliver Klein, Vice President and Head of Partner Product Management and Strategic AI Development Partnerships at SAP SE
  • Stefan Wellner, Vice President of Technology Alliances, Platform and Incubation Partnerships at SAP Business AI Ecosystem at SAP SE
  • Tom Adams, Director of Global Business Consulting and Advisory Partners at AWS USA 

 ü•á Winner: Atos

Atos presented an AI-Powered Supply Chain Disruption Analysis solution that addresses external vulnerabilities in supply chains, particularly unforeseen disruptions. The solution integrates real-time hazard data with SAP metrics to enhance operational resilience. It also integrates SAP BTP services UI5 and CAP applications with AWS AI services, including the Anthropic Claude 4 Sonnet LLM model on Amazon Bedrock. Key features demonstrated include real-time disruption data collection and automated supplier prioritization integrated with SAP S/4HANA systems.

AI-Powered Supply Chain Disruption Analysis by Atos

ü•à1st Runner up - Capgemini

Capgemini demonstrated a GTS smart check solution that seamlessly integrates with SAP GTS and SAP S/4HANA. This solution effectively addresses challenges in import processing, where manual document handling and compliance checks result in delays. The solution significantly reduces import processing time, thereby saving substantial hours annually. This is achieved through the automation of data extraction and comparison from multiple document sources using the Anthropic Claude 4 Sonnet LLM model from Amazon Bedrock.

Capgemini's GTS Smart Check Solution

ü•â2nd Runner up - NTT Data

NTT Data unveiled its Voice Control ERP Assistant, a collaborative solution designed to alleviate the challenges associated with accessing ERP systems on the shop floor. This innovative solution addresses the inherent difficulties faced by workers in navigating unfamiliar ERP systems without disrupting their workflow. By seamlessly integrating SAPUI5 and HANA Cloud, SAP HANA Vector Engine, Generative AI Hub within SAP BTP Services, and Anthropic Claude LLM from Amazon Bedrock, including Amazon Polly for voice interaction, the solution enables hands-free access to ERP data and documentation. Specifically targeting the manufacturing industry, the solution demonstrated substantial business value by enhancing task focus and mitigating employee turnover.

Voice Controlled ERP Assistant by NTT Data

üëèüèº Finalists

We thank all the finalist teams who successfully demonstrated the innovations to the panel of judges, as a part of this Hack2Build cohort.

FinalistsMinimal Viable Product demonstrated
AccentureNavi , a smart delivery scheduling solution focusing on the supply chain's inefficiencies in developing countries
CognizantAsset Unitization AI, addresses manual asset unitization challenges in asset-intensive industries
DeloitteRelationship Management Agent, automates the processing of email queries related to supplier and vendor management
IBMSustainable Buddy, addresses sustainability challenges for better operational transparency and efficiency in Oil & Gas
LTIMindtreeFieldSense.ai, enhances SAP Service and Asset Manager to streamline field service operations, improve safety, and ensure compliance in Utilities and Manufacturing
Phoenix ConsultingAutomated Supplier Invoice Processing, addresses high manual effort and error rates in accounts payable ,supporting Arabic characters and Hindu numerals
Tech MahindraImprove PO extraction  and Sales Order creation process, easing the process of extracting data from challenging invoice formats like blurry or multilingual images.

üôè  Special Thanks

We extend our appreciation to the many AWS and SAP experts , who coached the partners to successfully develop their solutions during this Hack2Build initiative.

‚òû  Next Phase

We anticipate that all participating partners will now proceed to finalize their comprehensive solution within a timeframe of 6 to 8 weeks. SAP and AWS will actively engage with all participating partners to provide support throughout their development process in the upcoming weeks, ensuring that their innovations are prepared for customer deployment.

entry.title: Key Highlights from the 2H 2025 Release of Onboarding
entry.content:
Hi Community,

The 2H 2025 release is here!

A new set of enhancements has been released in the 2H 2024 release that has been eagerly awaited. The SAP SuccessFactors 2H 2024 Release includes some key features and enhancements, so let's take a closer look!

1- Automate Manager Completion of New Hire Tasks:

Administrators can now use the new Auto-Complete functionality to automate the completion of manager tasks for specific new hire activities.

We added the Auto-Complete switch to the following new hire tasks:

  • Prepare for Day 1
  • Recommended Links
  • Write Welcome Message

Enablement: Automatically On

2- Automate National ID Information Extraction in Onboarding:

SAP Document AI, embedded edition automates the information extraction process for National IDs during the onboarding process.

To learn more about SAP Document AI, embedded edition's capabilities, see:

  • What Is SAP Document AI?
  • Subscribing to the SAP Document AI Workspace With the Identity Authentication Service

When enabled for SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding, SAP Document AI, embedded edition extracts information uploaded from a new hire's National ID and imports it into the system. This extraction occurs when a new hire uploads a copy of their National ID as part of the Personal Data Collections step, or by the hiring manager during the New Hire Data Review step.

Enablement: Customer Configured

Configuration Requirements:

  • You've purchased the SAP AI Units license. For more information about SAP AI Units license, contact your Account Executive.
  • You've enabled SAP Identity Authentication.
  • You've registered your application to communication with SAP SuccessFactors HCM Suite with Open ID Connect.
  • You've subscribed to the SAP Document AI Workspace with Identity Authentication service to handle authentication and authorization tasks.
  • You've enabled the Enable SAP Document AI, Embedded Edition switch from the Onboarding General Settings page.

3- Automate Onboarding Initiation from Recruiting:

As an administrator, you can now automatically initiate the onboarding process for candidates who are ready to be hired from SAP SuccessFactors Recruiting.

In addition to the existing options available in the Onboarding Integration Setup page, you can select the new Enable Automatic Initiation for Onboarding checkbox to ensure that the onboarding process is automatically initiated for all candidates who are eligible for onboarding from Recruiting. Selecting this automatically initiates onboarding for all job requisitions based on the onboarding initiation eligibility defined.       

Enablement: Customer Configured

Configuration Requirements:

  • As an administrator, navigate to Admin Center>Manage Recruiting Settings. Proceed to the Candidate Summary section and select Enable Latest Applicant Workbench, if not enabled already.
  • The recruiter must then navigate to Recruiting>Job Requisitions tab>Candidates option and enable the New Applicant Management Experience switch.

4- Automated Email Notifications for Pre-Onboarding Rehire Verification Task:

As an administrator, you can now trigger automated email notifications to remind responsible users to complete the pre-onboarding rehire verification tasks.

A new email template titled (ONB) Pre-Onboarding Rehire Template is added to the list of preconfigured templates. For more information on reusing the preconfigured template, refer to the Reusing Preconfigured Email Templates topic in the Related Information section.

       Enablement: Automatically On

5- Expected Ratings for Behaviors Available in Detailed 360 Report:

Users can now view expected ratings for behaviors after they've given ratings on a 360 Reviews form.

The Detailed 360 Report displays expected ratings for behaviors in both graphical and tabular views, similar to how expected ratings for competencies have been shown.

This improvement increases the consistency of how expected ratings are viewed on the Detailed 360 Report.

       Enablement: Automatically On

       Role-Based Permission Prerequisites:

You have the necessary permissions to access the Email Services tool in the Admin Center. For more information, see Role-Based Permissions for Email Services in the Related Information section.

6- Clear Previously Used Suggestions for New Hire Activities:

Hiring managers or onboarding participants can now use the Show Previously Used toggle to display or clear previously used recommendations.

The Show Previously Used toggle now appears at the top right of the page.

When disabled, the previously used recommended links disappear and the Recommend Links task moves to an unassigned state. Hiring managers and onboarding participants can add or remove recommended links as needed.

       Enablement: Automatically on

7- Creating Reports for Onboarding Tasks:

As an administrator, you can now use Story reports to generate reports of SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding tasks based on its due date.

You can use the Aggregated Details table in Story reports to generate reports for the following task types based on the latest due date for task completion:

       Enablement: Customer Configured

       Configuration Requirement:

  • Enable Story reports.

       Role-Based Permission Prerequisites:

  • Ensure to enable the Onboarding or Offboarding Object Permissions>Aggregated Details permission.

8- Enhanced Rehire Verification with National ID Validation:

We've improved the rehire verification process by implementing early data validation to prevent errors caused by identical national IDs.

This functionality is available on the Rehire Verification page within the onboarding process. When a new hire's national ID matches an existing record during either Pre-Onboarding Rehire Verification or Onboarding Rehire Verification, the system now prevents proceeding as a new hire, thereby avoiding duplicate entries. The button to proceed as new hire is grayed out, ensuring that you can't select it when a national ID match is detected.

        Enablement: Automatically on

For a detailed release summary, check out the ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs New Viewer‚Äù for a list of enhancements across the application.

entry.title: Re: Vendor Currency Supplier
entry.content:
FB60 is a FI transaction for vendor invoices without a purchase order. By default, the system uses the company code currency (local currency) in the header. The vendor‚Äôs currency maintained in the vendor master (Purchasing view) influences PO-based invoices (MIRO), not FB60.

One option is enhancement via BAdI or Substitution. Implement BAdI FI_DOCUMENT or Validation/Substitution in FI:

Logic:

  • Read vendor master (LFA1) for currency.
  • If vendor currency ‚â† company code currency, override the header currency before posting.

This is the most flexible approach for vendor-specific defaults.

entry.title: Bank statement - XML file with a webaddress in a tag - any solutions for uploading?
entry.content:
Dear all,

I hope one of you experts can help me. 

One of our clients has a problem with their bank statements, as they can't upload them into SAP Cloud ERP (public edition) as SAP doesn't recognize the file as a bank statement.

The reason that SAP doesn't recognise the file as a bank statement is because the bank has added a weblink / webaddress to the Entry tag (<Ntry>).  When I remove this manually, so the tag only looks like <Ntry> the file is uploaded as normal.  

The bank says this happens sometimes and that its not a problem for most ERP systems. They stated clearly that there is nothing they can or will do, and that it will have to be solved through the SAP system. I disagree but still have to try and find a solution. 

Does anyone know if there are any settings in SAP to make the system be able to read and accept the file with a webaddress? I have been unsuccesful in my search so hoping someone will have seen this situation before and be able to help.  

Many thanks in advance, 

M

entry.title: Re: Service consumption model (SRVC) - RFC - How to regnerate or edit a generated model?
entry.content:
Hello @rb,

You can't regenerate the Consumption Model, it is recommended to delete it and generate a new one.

You can check this community post for more details: Service Consumption Model 2 for OData Client Proxy

Also I would recommend to follow the SAP Help for the ADT 2023 FPS3 product and not the ADT BTP as they may be some differences in the docs, you can find it here.

entry.title: Re: Half the World Away: A Geospatial Cautionary Tale
entry.content:
Hi Elliott,

This is Stefan from the HANA Spatial Team. I'm sorry that HANA falsely returned 0 as distance in your computations. This is a bug and should not happen.

Can you share the exact version of your HANA instance?

SELECT * FROM SYS.M_DATABASE

I tried to reproduce the result on recent revisions of HANA 2 SPS 05, SPS 07 and SPS 08 and on the latest HANA Cloud QRCs. However, in my case, a non-zero distance was returned in all cases (~19,960,468m).

As you were speculating about the algorithm: Older versions of HANA used Vincenty's Formulae. But due to the converging issues with nearly anti-podal points, we switched to Karney's algorithm in the meantime (Algorithms for geodesics).

Best regards,

Stefan

entry.title: Re: üü° Fun for Week 2: Petoberfest üê±üê∂üêµüê∑üêªüê∏üêîüê¥ü¶¨ü¶éüê†ü¶úüêßüêåüêõ
How to change the device with MFA for Ariba Developer Portal
entry.content:
In order to change the device with MFA for Ariba Developer Portal, you first need to deactivate the existing MFA in the SAP Profile Management Portal.

https://accounts.sap.com/saml2/idp/sso?sp=sp.accounts.sap.com&RelayState=https://accounts.sap.com/ui/protected/profilemanagement

Once you are logged in to the portal, using relevant S-USER ID, go to authentication section, and deactivate the existing TOTP Two-Factor Authentication.

In the next step, choose any one deactivation channel and enter the required details. 

After, deactivation is successful, again activate the TOTP Two-Factor Authentication. A new QR code will pop up in the screen, you can scan it via your new device. 

After scanning is done, enter the passcode from your new device and complete the setup.

This completes the setup, your new device can be used for TOTP Two-Factor Authentication for portals like Ariba Developer Portal. Thanks!

entry.title: How to build side-by-side extensions for SAP S/4HANA public cloud with SAP BTP ABAP Trial
entry.content:
Introduction

The SAP BTP Trial has now been equipped with a central shared SAP S/4HANA public cloud instance that can be used to build side-by-side extensions. 

Since in the shared systems for the SAP BTP ABAP Environement developers are not allowed to create communication scenarios on their own this is now a great step forward since by providing pre-configure communication scenarios you are now able to walk through the development of a side-by-side scenario without having to bother with setting up the backend connectivity.  

In this article I give an overview how this setup can be leveraged in the shared trial systems for the ABAP Environment in SAP BTP Trial.

How to guides

The new setup is already been described in the following how-to-guides and missions:

SAP Discovery Center Mission - Develop extensions for SAP S/4HANA with SAP BTP, ABAP Environment, runtime

RAP620: Side-by-side extensibility with SAP BTP ABAP Environment

Technical background

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud backend

In the shared SAP S/4HANA Trial we have published read-only access to Product Master Data Including Classification using the following API 

Overview | Product Master Data Including Classification ‚Äì Read | SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

This has been achieved by setting up a communication arrangement in the SAP S/4HANA public cloud instance that is based on the Communication Scenario called Product Classification Integration (SAP_COM_0309).

In addition we have enabled read and write access to Sales Order Data using the followig API 

Overview | Sales Order (A2X) | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

his has been achieved by setting up a communication arrangement in the SAP S/4HANA public cloud instance that is based on the Communication Scenario called Sales Order Integration (SAP_COM_0109) .

SAP BTP ABAP Environment - Trial

On the consumer side, in the shared SAP BTP ABAP Environment trial instances, we have created communication scenarios as well that allow for the consumption of the aforementioned scenarios.

SAP_COM_0109 (Sales Order Data)

DATA(lo_destination) = cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement(
                                                         comm_scenario  = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0109'
                                                         comm_system_id = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0109'
                                                         service_id     = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0109_REST'
                                                       ).

SAP_COM_0309 (Product Master Data)

DATA(lo_destination) = cl_http_destination_provider=>create_by_comm_arrangement(
                                                     comm_scenario  = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0309'
                                                     comm_system_id = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0309'
                                                     service_id     = 'ZBTP_TRIAL_SAP_COM_0309_REST'
                                                   ).

Test classes

In the shared trial systems you will find two test classes 

  • zcl_test_api_sales_order_srv
  • zsc_test_api_clfn_product_srv

that you can run as a console application by simply pressing F9 to show a list of products and to create a sales order in the SAP S/4HANA public shared backend system.

Especially the class zcl_test_api_sales_order_srv is of interest since it shows how to fill the description node for deep business data, so that it allows you to create the sales order header data alongside with one or more items.
